result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke J. McGowan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
FORTHWITH
--Tthe Court sentences Mr. McGowan to 3 years 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &  0  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  years &  6  months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $550 to Jerome Ehrke

** Per Attached Standing Order 10% Restitution Surcharge Added**

--to pay statutory costs

--to pay $44 in subpoena fees
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent

--absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent

--no contact with Jessica Boeve or her son or Jerome Ehrke. No presence at their residence. Violation of no contact is a felony. With one exception if Defendant wants to write a single letter of apology to them to be given to them by Agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent

-- random drug and/or alcohol screening

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations  per Agent

[Prior to hearing: Character Letters, Victim Impact Statement, Revised Criminal Case Settlement and Drug Testing Results provided to the Court by Counsel]

Case called at 8:39am [MA]
Defendant Luke J. McGowan in court with Attorney David Westrick.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; indicates that victim is present in courtroom gallery

Maximum penalties recited by the Court; Mr. McGowan confirms understanding
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court finds that the restitution requested by Jerome Ehrke is reasonable and there is a proper nexus to order restitution

Statement made by Mr. McGowan

On Case 15CF205, Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. McGowan to 3 years 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &  0  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  years &  6  months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   4  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--no contact with Jessica Boeve or her son or Jerome Ehrke. No presence at their residence. Violation of no contact is a felony. With one exception if Defendant wants to write a single letter of apology to them to be given to them by Agent
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay $44 in subpoena fees
--to pay restitution in the amount of $550 to Jerome Ehrke

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 9:35am

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CF205; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-15CF205
On Motion of the State, the Court dismiss outright Case 15CM164 - Court finds victim rights compliance in this matter
On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Case 15CM93 - Court finds victim rights compliance in this matter
Atty Westrick requests that the Court set out sentencing as far out as the Court will allow; Court cancels trial

Defendant Luke J. McGowan in court with Attorney David Robert Westrick.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. McGowan. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Atty. Westrick indicates that there is an additional case and will be requesting Discovery from the State; requests a PTC to discuss global resolution of cases. 

The Court notes that the Court has signed the Dismissal of Case 15CM164 and therefore will take no further action on this case and does NOT call this case.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

Case called at 1:20 pm [sf]
Defendant Luke J. McGowan in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert appearing for the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Dahnert informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD and that Attorney Westrick will be appointed.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
DOB verified. New Address information provided.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Jessica Boeve or her son
-No presence at N2681 CTH N in Fort Atkinson

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Case called at 2:33pm [mo]
Defendant Luke J. McGowan not in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews Court Record

ADA Teuber orally motions for a warrant.

The Court issues a probable cause warrant, body only. This warrant is extraditable
